snippet: In 1953, George Tames went to the heartland on assignment for The New York Times to photograph the effects of an overabundant harvest, finding a combination of vastness as well as isolation.
abstract: In 1953, George Tames went to the heartland on assignment for The New York Times to photograph the effects of an overabundant harvest, finding a combination of vastness as well as isolation.

byline.original: By DARCY EVELEIGH and JOHN LELAND

headline.main: Surplus and Solitude in the Breadbasket
